intro: Diplasia karatifolia, commonly known as the karatifoliate diplasia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes numerous species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences. Diplasia karatifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
